heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: Currently no stormy weather.  The most recent storm happened on 21 September 2025 and it lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 5.2°C), outside temperature (down 4.9°C), and inside temperature (down 2.3°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 10%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 8327 lux), cloud levels (up 871 m), and pressure (down 8 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 9640 lux) and cloud levels (up 410 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 870.8m lower than yesterday, 72.8m lower than the past week, 409.8m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 1104m to a maximum of 3920m, averaging 1392.1m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1464.9m and 1801.9m respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, the air will feel dry and little or no wind. Drizzle or light rain possible, occasional overcast conditions, and light levels will be low during the day. Weather patterns to stay the same.
